Lesson 1 (A2) – Conjunctions

Conjunctions are words that connect sentences or ideas, such as 'and', 'or', 'but', 'because'.
Example in English: I eat pizza because I like pizza.

3 Simple Conjunctions

In German, the 3 most common simple conjunctions are:

  • und – and
  • oder – or
  • aber – but
When using simple conjunctions, the sentence structure does not change, the words are just connected.
Examples:
Ich trinke Tee und du trinkst Tee.
Ich esse Pizza und er isst Pizza.
Ich liebe Tee aber ich trinke Kaffee.

Verb Movers – Weil, Obwohl, Wenn

Most conjunctions in German affect the sentence structure. We will call them Verb Movers, because they push the verb to the end of the second clause.
The 3 Verb Movers are:

  • weil – because
  • obwohl – even though
  • wenn – if/when
Golden Rule for Verb Movers:
1. The first part of the sentence does not change.
2. In the second part, the conjugated verb goes to the end.

Examples:
I drink tea because I love tea – Ich trinke Tee weil ich Tee liebe.
I play cricket because I love cricket – Ich spiele Cricket weil ich Cricket liebe.
I play cricket even though I love tennis – Ich spiele Cricket obwohl ich Tennis liebe.
I play cricket when I have a ball – Ich spiele Cricket wenn ich einen Ball habe.

Conjunctions with Modal Verbs

Conjunctions are often used with modal verbs. The rules remain the same:
– First sentence stays the same.
– Conjugated verb in the second sentence moves to the end.

Examples:
I love cricket because I can play cricket – Ich liebe Cricket weil ich Cricket spielen kann.
I eat pasta even though I want to eat pizza – Ich esse Pasta obwohl ich Pizza essen will.

Summary

Simple Conjunctions: und, oder, aber (no sentence structure change).
Verb Movers: weil, obwohl, wenn (verb in the second part moves to the end).
Golden Rule: First sentence unchanged, second sentence verb goes to the end.
